<A NAME="HII201610-K_HTM_SA745AF84CE7DF6B5CECA998DFE5272BB">

<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PART I
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="HII201610-K_HTM_S91FD1C4B5083A3EE9E92998DFE833E75">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 1. BUSINESS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="HII201610-K_HTM_S7586D276B9211E9DA08C998DFEA5E1FB">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	History and Organization
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Huntington Ingalls Industries, Inc. ("HII", the "Company", "we", "us", or "our") is America&#8217;s largest military shipbuilding company and a provider of professional services to partners in government and industry. For more than a century, our Ingalls Shipbuilding ("Ingalls") and Newport News Shipbuilding ("Newport News") segments in Mississippi and Virginia have built more ships in more ship classes than any other U.S. naval shipbuilder. Our Technical Solutions segment was established in December 2016 and provides a wide range of professional services, including fleet support, integrated missions solutions, and nuclear and environmental and oil and gas services.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We conduct most of our business with the U.S. Government, principally the Department of Defense ("DoD"). As prime contractor, principal subcontractor, team member, or partner, we participate in many high-priority U.S. defense technology programs. Ingalls includes our non-nuclear ship design, construction, repair, and maintenance businesses. Newport News includes all of our nuclear ship design, construction, overhaul, refueling, and repair and maintenance businesses. We also provide a range of services to the governmental, energy, and oil and gas markets through our Technical Solutions segment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, we employ approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	37,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;people operating both domestically and internationally. We became an independent, publicly-owned company in 2011, when we were spun off from Northrop Grumman.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="HII201610-K_HTM_S1F1E733ACD6806BC3DF0998DFED5972A">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Ingalls
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Through our Ingalls segment, we design and construct non-nuclear ships for the U.S.&#160;Navy and U.S.&#160;Coast Guard, including amphibious assault ships, surface combatants, and National Security Cutters ("NSCs"). We are the sole builder of amphibious assault ships and one of two builders of surface combatants for the U.S. Navy. We are the sole builder of large multi-mission NSCs for the U.S.&#160;Coast Guard. Our Ingalls segment is located in Pascagoula, Mississippi on 800 acres along the Pascagoula River. This shipyard offers a collection of manufacturing capabilities that includes a 660-ton gantry crane and a Land Based Test Facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In October 2014, we ceased shipbuilding construction operations at our Avondale, Louisiana shipyard ("Avondale") and consolidated that activity at our Pascagoula, Mississippi facility, which we believe has enhanced our competitive position by decreasing our fixed overhead expenses, improving facility utilization to provide a more cost-efficient construction process, centralizing our shipbuilding learning and increasing the benefits of serial production, and reducing program costs. In March 2015, we sold our Gulfport Composite Center of Excellence (the "Gulfport facility") in Gulfport, Mississippi, to the Mississippi State Port Authority, due to limited demand from the U.S. Navy for composite products provided by our Gulfport facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Amphibious Assault Ships
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We construct amphibious assault and expeditionary warfare ships for the U.S. Navy, which include the U.S. Navy large deck amphibious ships ("LHA") and amphibious transport dock ships ("LPD"). The LHA is a key component of the U.S. Navy-Marine Corps requirement for 11 Expeditionary Strike Groups/Amphibious Readiness Groups, and design, construction, and modernization of LHAs are core to our Ingalls operations. In 2007, we were awarded the construction contract for USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	America
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(LHA 6), the first in a new class of enhanced amphibious assault ships designed from the keel up to be an aviation optimized Marine assault platform. We delivered USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	America
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(LHA 6) in the second quarter of 2014, are currently constructing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Tripoli
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(LHA 7), scheduled for delivery in 2018, and in 2016 were awarded the construction contract for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Bougainville
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(LHA 8).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The LPD program is a long-running production program in which we have generated efficiencies through ship-over-ship learning.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We are currently constructing two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	San Antonio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LPD 17) amphibious transport dock ships,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Portland
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(LPD 27) and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Fort Lauderdale
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(LPD 28), scheduled for delivery in 2017 and 2021, respectively. In 2016, we delivered USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	John P. Murtha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(LPD 26).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</DIV>
