<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Operating Activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	provided by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;operating activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$822 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$861 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The decrease of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$39 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in operating cash flow was primarily due to higher funding of retiree benefit plans, a change in trade working capital, and the impact in 2015 of the settlement of the Aon litigation. The change in trade working capital was primarily driven by accounts receivable and accounts payable due to timing of receipts and payments, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We expect cash generated from operations in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, in combination with our current cash and cash equivalents, as well as existing credit facilities, to be sufficient to service debt and retiree benefit plans, meet contractual obligations, and finance capital expenditures for at least the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	provided by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;operating activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$861 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$755 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The favorable change of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$106 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in operating cash flow was primarily due to proceeds from the Aon litigation settlement and a change in funding of retiree benefit plans, partially offset by higher payments for income taxes and a change in trade working capital. The change in trade working capital was primarily driven by accounts receivable and accounts payable due to timing of receipts and payments, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	used in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;investing activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$653 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	an increase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$512 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The change in investing cash flow was driven by the acquisition of Camber in 2016, higher capital expenditures in 2016, the sale of the Gulfport Composite Center of Excellence in March 2015, and proceeds in 2015 from the Aon litigation settlement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we expect our capital expenditures for maintenance and sustainment to be approximately 2.0% to 2.5% of annual revenues and our discretionary capital expenditures to be approximately 2.5% to 3.0% of annual revenues.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	used in

	&#32;investing activities was

	$141 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a decrease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$296 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The favorable change in investing cash flow was driven by the 2014 acquisitions of UPI and SN3, the sale of the Gulfport Composite Center of Excellence in March 2015, and proceeds from the Aon litigation settlement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	used in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;financing activities in

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$343 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$816 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	used in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The change was primarily due to decreases of $449 million of debt related expenditures, $38 million of common stock repurchases, and $3 million in employee tax withholdings on share-based payment arrangements, partially offset by an additional $17 million of cash dividend payments in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;compared to

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	used in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;financing activities in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$816 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$371 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	used in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The increase was primarily due to an additional $316 million of long-term debt repayment, $94 million of repurchases of common stock, $32 million of cash dividend payments, $11 million of debt related expenditures, as well as a $6 million decrease in excess tax benefit related to stock based compensation and a $2 million decrease in proceeds from stock options exercised.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Free Cash Flow
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Free cash flow represents cash provided by (used in) operating activities less capital expenditures. Free cash flow is not a measure recognized under GAAP. Free cash flow has limitations as an analytical tool and should not be considered in isolation from, or as a substitute for, analysis of our results as reported under GAAP. We believe free cash flow is an important liquidity measure for our investors because it provides them insight into our current and period-to-period performance and our ability to generate cash from continuing operations. We also use free cash flow as a key operating metric in assessing the performance of our business and as a key performance measure in evaluating management performance and determining incentive compensation. Free cash flow may not be comparable to similarly titled measures of other companies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	55
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following table reconciles net cash provided by operating activities to free cash flow:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Free cash flow decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$136 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, primarily due to capital expenditures, higher funding of retiree benefit plans, a change in trade working capital, and the impact in 2015 of the settlement of the Aon litigation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Free cash flow increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$83 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, primarily due to proceeds from the Aon litigation settlement and a change in funding of retiree benefit plans, partially offset by higher payments for income taxes, capital expenditures, and a change in trade working capital.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Retirement Related Benefit Plan Contributions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ERISA, including amendments under pension relief, defines the minimum amount that must be contributed to our qualified defined benefit pension plans. In determining whether to make discretionary contributions to these plans above the minimum required amounts, we consider various factors, including maintaining the funded status needed to avoid potential benefit restrictions and other adverse consequences, maintaining minimum CAS funding requirements, and the current and anticipated future funding levels of each plan. The contributions to our qualified defined benefit pension plans are affected by a number of factors, including published IRS interest rates, the actual return on plan assets, actuarial assumptions, and demographic experience. These factors and our resulting contributions also impact the plans' funded statuses. If the IRS publishes updated mortality tables for funding purposes, our pension contributions could be affected. We made the following minimum and discretionary contributions to our pension and other postretirement plans in the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</DIV>

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We made discretionary contributions to our qualified defined benefit pension plans totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$167 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$99 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$123 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our qualified pension plans were funded 83% and 84%, respectively, on a FAS basis. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, these plans were sufficiently funded on an ERISA basis so as not to be subject to benefit payment restrictions. The funded percentages under ERISA and FAS vary due to inherent differences in the assumptions and methodologies used to develop respective obligations for these two different purposes. We expect our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;cash contributions to our qualified defined benefit pension plans to be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$290 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, all of which we anticipate will be discretionary and are exclusive of CAS cost recoveries in our contracts. Due to the differences in calculation methodologies, our FAS expense is not necessarily representative of our funding requirements or CAS cost recoveries.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Other Sources and Uses of Capital
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stockholder Distributions -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November 2016, our board of directors authorized an increase in our quarterly cash dividend to $0.60 per share. The board previously increased the quarterly cash dividend to $0.50 per share in October 2015 and $0.40 per share in October 2014. We paid cash dividends totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$98 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share),
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$81 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$1.70
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share), and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$49 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share) in the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In October 2015, our board of directors authorized an increase in our existing stock repurchase program to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1,200 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our common stock. The board previously authorized an increase in our existing stock repurchase program from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$300 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$600 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in October 2014. Repurchases are made from time to time at management's discretion in accordance with applicable federal securities laws. For the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company settled for cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of shares repurchased in the prior year. For the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we repurchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,266,192
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,987,550
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,407,729
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares, respectively, at aggregate costs of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$192 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$234 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$138 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Additional Capital
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	- In November 2015, we issued $600 million aggregate principal amount of 5.000% senior notes due November 2025, the net proceeds from which were used to repurchase our 7.125% senior notes due in 2021. In December 2014, we issued $600 million aggregate principal amount of 5.000% senior notes due December 2021, the net proceeds from which were used to repurchase our 6.875% senior notes due in 2018. Interest on our senior notes is payable semi-annually.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In July 2015, we entered into the Amended Credit Facility with third-party lenders. The Amended Credit Facility includes a revolving credit facility of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1,250 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which may be drawn upon during a period of five years from July 13, 2015. The revolving credit facility includes a letter of credit subfacility of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&#160;The revolving credit facility has a variable interest rate on outstanding borrowings based on the London Interbank Offered Rate ("LIBOR") plus a spread based upon our leverage ratio, which may vary between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The revolving credit facility also has a commitment fee rate on the unutilized balance based on our leverage ratio. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in letters of credit were issued but undrawn under the revolving credit facility, and the remaining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1,225 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was unutilized.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We made term loan payments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$395 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;during the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, using cash generated from operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We were in compliance with all debt-related covenants as of and during the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. For a description of our outstanding debt amounts and related restrictive covenants, see Note 14: Debt in Item 8.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="HII201610-K_HTM_SFA95B38291DD03F28515998DE69470EB">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our total outstanding long-term debt was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1,278 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, consisting of senior notes and other third-party debt. For a description of our outstanding debt amounts and related restrictive covenants, see Note 14: Debt in Item 8.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the spin-off, we entered into a Tax Matters Agreement with Northrop Grumman (the "Tax Matters Agreement"), which governs the respective rights, responsibilities, and obligations of Northrop Grumman and us after the spin-off with respect to tax liabilities and benefits, tax attributes, tax contests, and other tax sharing regarding U.S.&#160;federal, state, local, and foreign income taxes, other taxes, and related tax returns. We have several liabilities with Northrop Grumman to the Internal Revenue Service ("IRS") for the consolidated U.S.&#160;federal income taxes of the Northrop Grumman consolidated group relating to the taxable periods in which we were part of that group. The Tax Matters Agreement specifies the portion of this tax liability for which we will bear responsibility, and Northrop Grumman has agreed to indemnify us against any amounts for which we are not responsible.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	57
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,135
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,294
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:6PT">
	(1)
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A "purchase obligation" is defined as an agreement to purchase goods or services that is enforceable and legally binding on us and that specifies all significant terms, including: fixed or minimum quantities to be purchased; fixed, minimum, or variable price provisions; and the approximate timing of the transaction. These amounts are primarily comprised of open purchase order commitments to vendors and subcontractors pertaining to funded contracts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:24PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:6PT">
	(2)
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Other long-term liabilities primarily consist of total accrued workers' compensation reserves, deferred compensation, and other miscellaneous liabilities, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$217 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is the current portion of workers' compensation liabilities. It excludes obligations for uncertain tax positions of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, for which the timing of the payments, if any, cannot be reasonably estimated.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The above table excludes retirement related contributions. Amounts for retirement related contributions depend on plan provisions, actuarial assumptions, actual plan asset performance, and other factors described above under Retirement Related Benefit Plans under Critical Accounting Policies, Estimates and Judgments and under Liquidity and Capital Resources.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Further details regarding long-term debt and operating leases can be found in Note 14: Debt and Note 16: Commitments and Contingencies in Item 8.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In the ordinary course of business, we use standby letters of credit issued by commercial banks and surety bonds issued by insurance companies principally to support our self-insured workers' compensation plans. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in standby letters of credit were issued but undrawn and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$356 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of surety bonds were outstanding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had no other significant off-balance sheet arrangements other than operating leases. For a description of our operating leases, see Note 2: Summary of Significant Accounting Policies and Note 16: Commitments and Contingencies in Item 8.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	58

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	GLOSSARY OF PROGRAMS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Included below are brief descriptions of some of the programs discussed in this Annual Report on Form 10-K.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:39%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:3%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:58%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Program Name
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Program Description
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	America
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LHA 6) amphibious assault ships
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Design and build large deck amphibious assault ships that provide forward presence and power projection as an integral part of joint, interagency and multinational maritime expeditionary forces. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	America
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LHA 6) ships, together with the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Wasp
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LHD 1) ships, are the successors to the decommissioned
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Tarawa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LHA 1) ships. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	America
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LHA 6) ships optimize aviation operations and support capabilities. We delivered USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	America
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(LHA 6) in April 2014, and T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ripoli
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(LHA 7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	is currently under construction.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Arleigh Burke
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (DDG 51) destroyers
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Build guided missile destroyers designed for conducting anti-air, anti-submarine, anti-surface, and strike operations. The Aegis-equipped
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Arleigh Burke
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;class (DDG 51) destroyers are the U.S. Navy's primary surface combatant, and have been constructed in variants, allowing technological advances during construction. In 2016 we delivered
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	John Finn
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(DDG 113), and we are currently constructing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ralph Johnson
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(DDG 114). In June 2013, we were awarded a multi-year contract for construction of five additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Arleigh Burke
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (DDG 51) destroyers. The first three ships of that award,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Paul Ignatius
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(DDG 117),
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Delbert D. Black
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(DDG 119), and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Frank E. Petersen Jr.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(DDG 121), are currently under construction.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
	Carrier RCOH
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Perform refueling and complex overhaul ("RCOH") of nuclear-powered aircraft carriers, which is required at the mid-point of their 50-year life cycle. USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Abraham Lincoln
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(CVN 72) is currently undergoing RCOH and advance planning efforts for USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	George Washington
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(CVN 73) are in process in preparation for the expected start of its RCOH in 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Columbia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (SSBN 826) submarines
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The U.S. Navy has committed to designing the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Columbia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (SSBN 826) submarine as a replacement for the current aging
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ohio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class nuclear ballistic missile submarines, which were first introduced into service in 1981. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ohio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class SSBN includes 14 nuclear ballistic missile submarines and four nuclear cruise missile submarines. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Columbia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (SSBN 826) program currently anticipates 12 new ballistic missile submarines. The U.S. Navy has initiated the design process for the new class of submarines, and, in early 2017, the DOD signed the acquisition decision memorandum approving the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Columbia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;class (SSBN 826) program&#8217;s Milestone B, which formally authorizes the program&#8217;s entry into the engineering and manufacturing development phase. We continue to perform design work as a subcontractor to Electric Boat, and we have entered into a team agreement with Electric Boat to build modules for the entire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Columbia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (SSBN 826) submarine program that leverages our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Virginia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (SSN 774) experience. The team agreement is subject to the U.S. Navy's concurrence. Construction of the first
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Columbia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (SSBN 826) submarine is expected to begin in 2021, with procurement of long-lead-time materials and advance construction beginning prior to that time.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Fleet support services
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Provide comprehensive life-cycle sustainment services to the U.S. Navy fleet and other DoD and commercial maritime customers. We provide services including maintenance, modernization, and repair on all ship classes; naval architecture, marine engineering, and design; integrated logistics support; technical documentation development; warehousing, asset management, and material readiness; operational and maintenance training development and delivery; software design and development; IT infrastructure support and data delivery and management; and cyber security and information assurance. We provide undersea vehicle and specialized craft development and prototyping services.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:39%;">

</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Gerald R. Ford
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (CVN 78) aircraft carriers
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Design and construction for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ford
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class program, which is the aircraft carrier replacement program for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	USS Enterprise
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(CVN 65) and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Nimitz class
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(CVN 68) aircraft carriers.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Gerald R. Ford
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(CVN 78), the first ship of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ford
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class, is currently under construction. In June 2015, we were awarded a contract for the detail design and construction of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	John F. Kennedy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(CVN 79), following several years of engineering, advance construction, and purchase of long-lead time components and material. This category also includes the class' non-recurring engineering. The class is expected to bring improved warfighting capability, quality of life improvements for sailors, and reduced life cycle costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Integrated missions solutions services
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Provide services including high-end information technology and mission-based solutions to DoD, intelligence, and federal civilian customers. Services include agile software engineering, development, and integration; Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance ("C4ISR") engineering and software integration; mobile application development and network engineering; modeling, simulation, and training; force protection and emergency management training and exercises; unmanned systems development, integration, operations, and maintenance; and mission-oriented intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance analytics.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Legend
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class National Security Cutter
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Design and build the U.S. Coast Guard's National Security Cutters ("NSCs"), the largest and most technically advanced class of cutter in the U.S. Coast Guard. The NSC is equipped to carry out maritime homeland security, maritime safety, protection of natural resources, maritime mobility, and national defense missions. The plan is for a total of nine ships, of which the first six ships have been delivered.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Kimball
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(NSC 7) and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Midgett
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(NSC 8) are currently under construction.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Naval nuclear support services
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Provide services to and in support of the U.S. Navy, ranging from services supporting the Navy's carrier and submarine fleets to maintenance services at U.S. Navy training facilities. Naval nuclear support services include design, construction, maintenance, and disposal activities for in service U.S. Navy nuclear ships worldwide through mobile and in-house capabilities. Services include maintenance services on nuclear reactor prototypes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Nuclear and environmental services
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Provide services in nuclear management and operations, and nuclear and non-nuclear fabrication and repair. We provide site management, nuclear and industrial facilities operations and maintenance, decontamination and decommissioning, and radiological and hazardous waste management services. We provide services, including fabrication, equipment repair, and technical engineering services. Participate in a joint venture, Savannah River Nuclear Solutions, LLC, which provides site management and operations at the DoE's Savannah River Site near Aiken, South Carolina.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Oil and gas services
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Deliver engineering, procurement, and construction management services to the oil and gas industry for major pipeline, production, and treatment facilities. These services include full life-cycle services for domestic and international projects, from concept identification through detail design, execution and construction, and decommissioning. Related field services include survey, inspection, commissioning and start-up, operations and maintenance, and optimization and debottlenecking.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_24"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:39%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:3%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:58%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	San&#160;Antonio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LPD 17) amphibious transport dock ships
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Design and build amphibious transport dock ships, which are warships that embark, transport, and land elements of a landing force for a variety of expeditionary warfare missions, and also serve as the secondary aviation platform for Amphibious Readiness Groups. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	San Antonio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LPD 17) is the newest addition to the U.S. Navy's 21st century amphibious assault force, and these ships are a key element of the U.S. Navy's seabase transformation. In 2013, we delivered USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Somerset
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(LPD 25), and in 2016, we delivered USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	John P. Murtha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(LPD 26)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We are currently constructing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Portland
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(LPD 27) and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Fort Lauderdale
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(LPD-28)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	San Antonio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (LPD 17) currently includes a total of 11 ships.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:5PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	USS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Enterprise
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;(CVN 65)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Defuel and inactivate the world's first nuclear-powered aircraft carrier, which began in 2013.
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Virginia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (SSN 774) fast attack submarines
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Construct attack submarines as the principal subcontractor to Electric Boat. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Virginia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	class (SSN 774) is a post-Cold War design tailored to excel in a wide range of warfighting missions, including anti-submarine and surface ship warfare; special operation forces; strike; intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance; carrier and expeditionary strike group support; and mine warfare.
</FONT>

<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 7A.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We are exposed to certain market risks, primarily related to interest rates and foreign currency exchange rates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Interest Rates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	- Our financial instruments potentially subject to interest rate risk include floating rate borrowings under our Amended Credit Facility. Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	$1,250 million revolving facility under our Amended Credit Facility was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;undrawn as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Foreign Currency
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- We currently have, and in the future may enter into, foreign currency forward contracts to manage foreign currency exchange rate risk related to payments to suppliers denominated in foreign currencies. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the fair values of our outstanding foreign currency forward contracts were not significant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	61
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
